content.text:
Commercial parking expansion. Upon obtaining special permit approval
from the Board of Appeals, accessory automobile parking only at and/or
below grade only shall be permitted. Full screening shall be provided
on any residentially utilized sides of such lot, including the street
frontage of the CX District in accordance with the provisions of this
chapter. All permitted parking is to be an accessory use to a permitted
use located within an abutting C-1, C-2 or C-3 District only, and
all entrances and exits from such parking area shall be through abutting
C-1, C-2 or C-3 District lots. All vehicular traffic entering or exiting
such parking area shall flow to or from a C-1, C-2 or C-3 District
and shall be directed away from any R District.
Single-family dwellings.

Mother-daughter residences, upon obtaining special permit approval
from the Board of Appeals.
Two-family dwellings.
Places of worship.
Public schools of general or special instruction.
Upon obtaining special use permit approval from the Board of Appeals:

Residential accommodations for persons engaged in the activities
of places of worship and religious related uses.
Home occupations.
Home professional offices.
Private schools of religious, special or general instruction.
Clubhouses or lodges.
Nursery schools.
Philanthropic or charitable associations.

Buildings, structures or uses accessory to permitted uses within
the district.

Parks and parklands, municipal uses, police, fire and ambulance facilities,
public parking facilities and public recreational facilities.

Commercial parking expansion, parks and parklands, municipal and
public uses: none required.
Coverage.

Maximum coverage of lot by aggregate building area of all buildings
thereon: 50%.

Maximum coverage of lot by aggregate building area of all buildings
and structures therein: 70%.
Floor area ratio: .5 (1 to 2).
Open space ratio: 150% (1.5 to 1).
Minimum frontage.
Single-family dwellings: 50 feet.
Two-family dwellings: 60 feet.

Places of worship, public and private schools of general instruction
and special instruction, schools of religious instruction, clubhouses
or lodges, nursery schools, philanthropic or charitable associations:
80 feet.
Minimum area.
Single-family dwellings: 5,000 square feet.
Two-family dwellings: 6,000 square feet.
Places of worship; all schools: 8,000 square feet.
Maximum for all buildings.
Stories: three.
Height: 35 feet.
Maximum for all accessory buildings and structures.
Garages: 15 feet.
All other accessory buildings: 10 feet.

All other accessory structures: 10 feet, unless otherwise specified
by this chapter.
Front setback.
Commercial parking expansion: none required.

All other uses: 25 feet, except that in the case of a corner
lot, a front setback shall be required on each street and each such
front yard setback shall be at least 25 feet.
Side setbacks.
Commercial parking expansion: none required.
Single-family dwellings.
Minimum width of each of two side setbacks: five feet.
Aggregate width of both side setbacks: 15 feet.

On corner lots, there shall be one minimum side setback requirement:
five feet.
Two-family dwellings.
Minimum width of each of two side setbacks: 10 feet.
Aggregate width of both side setbacks: 20 feet.

On corner lots, there shall be one minimum side setback requirement:
10 feet.

Places of worship; all schools, clubhouses or lodges, philanthropic
or charitable associations.
Minimum width of each of two side setbacks: 15 feet.
Aggregate width of both side setbacks: 30 feet.

Accessory buildings and structures, except swimming pools and
fences.

Attached garages and other attached accessory structures: five
feet.

Detached garages and other detached accessory buildings or structures:
two feet.
Rear setback.
Commercial parking expansion: none required.

Dwellings, places of worship and all schools: 25 feet, except
that on a lot of less than 100 feet in depth, the rear setback need
not exceed 25% of the depth of the lot with a minimum required rear
setback of 15 feet. In the case of a corner lot, the rear setback
shall be five feet.

Detached garages and other detached accessory buildings or structures:
two feet.

Every single-family dwelling shall have a total minimum habitable
floor area of 1,200 square feet, except that a detached single-family
dwelling which has a mother-daughter residence shall have a total
minimum habitable floor area of 1,450 square feet. A mother-daughter
residence dwelling unit shall have not less than 250 square feet of
habitable floor area.

Every two-family dwelling shall have a minimum habitable floor area
of 2,000 square feet.

Screening shall be required along any lot line as specified of a
premises used for nonresidential or commercial parking expansion purposes
where such premises abuts a residential use or residential district
boundary, including all lot lines facing a residential district boundary
across a street. Screening shall be provided with:

A strip of densely planted shrubs or evergreen trees at least
three feet above grade at the time of planting and which shall form
a year-round dense screen at least six feet high within three years
for lots adjacent to the boundary of a residential use district and
at least four feet high for lots situated across a street from a residential
district or along any portion of an abutting residential front yard;
or

A wall or solid wood or commercial grade slatted chain link
fence, six feet high for lots adjacent to a residential district boundary
and four feet high for lots situated across a street from a residential
district or along any portion of an abutting residential front yard.

Commercial parking expansion uses shall comply with both fencing
and landscaping requirements for lots located across the street from
a residential district except that open fences are permitted and all
fencing shall be located to the interior of the landscaping.

Screening shall be maintained in good condition and within property
bounds at all times, by the owner of the property or successors in
interest or assignees.
Entrances and exits may interrupt screening.

No signs or advertisements shall be attached to the side of the screening
facing any residential district other than traffic or caution signs.
Off-street parking: see Article XXII.
Off-street loading: see Article XXIII.
Supplementary height, area and bulk requirements: see Article XV.

Supplementary accessory uses, building or structures: see Article
XVI.
Signs: see Article XVII.
Fences: see Article XVIII.
Swimming pools: see Article XIX.
Special use permits: see Article XX.
Mother-daughter residence: see Article XXI.
Corner sight triangle: see Article XXX.
